p:
Another African plant, Helichrysum aureonitens, was tested by Meyer et al.
103 for its reported antimicrobial properties and showed antiviral activity against HSV-1 in human lung fibroblast cells. A crude aqueous extract was prepared from plant shoots, excluding its flowers, and simultaneously added with HSV-1 viral suspension to cells. After 1 week of incubation, no cytotoxic effect was noted in cells and significant antiviral activity was exhibited at an extract concentration of 1.35 mg/ml.
